topic.title: ZeroCDN - anybody use it or have a clear version of the code for zerocdn.js ?
topic.body: I like the idea of reducing redundancy in shared files like jquery, but I want to read the js file in an understandable format first.  Address for reference : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1AMh6MG4K59ki1dPXX1PrgzeeqkMmZ1YKm/docs.html

2_1MA9FAQkvuKGyyr29ecGJ3FtMjPKBtJhpU.body: I'm assuming that when the box pops up saying "ERR0R - SearchEngine based on ZeroTalk" that means no content found.

1_1Hk3VC1SpvpXdhSYFPsQRowJC1mDnWESoX.body:
> [kindlyfire](#comment_20_1FTFKztuv4Z5uy6iS83k9hB2xtS6yFnDxx): Personally, I don't like the idea of a shared CDN. These files weight a couple of KB at maximum, and every site having its own JQuery has an advantage: decentralisation. What happens if the owner of a CDN modifies the file ? Everybody using that CDN will be doomed.

Good point, although a couple KB at maximum is a definite understatement. jQuery 2.1 is 83kb minimized.

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: I would like to authorize a user to be able to edit & sign my site. What piece of information do they send me from their users.json and where do I enter it in the site's content.json?
